benchmark_details.name: P-MME VAL (Parallel Multilingual Multitask Benchmark for Consistent Evaluation of LLMs)
benchmark_details.overview: P-MME VAL is a comprehensive multilingual multitask benchmark that incorporates both fundamental and capability-specialized tasks, ensuring consistent language coverage and providing parallel samples across different languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a comprehensive evaluation system that unifies diverse NLP and capability-specialized tasks, ensuring consistent language coverage per task and offering parallel samples across languages.

data.source: Combinations of datasets such as XNLI, MH ELLA SWAG, HUMAN EVAL-XL, MGSM, ML OGIQA, MMMLU, and others.
data.size: Data spans across multiple datasets with a combined total of approximately 15,000 examples per language across 10 languages.
data.annotation: Datasets involve both manual annotation and curated translations with expert reviews.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the performance of models on various tasks across multiple languages, with results aggregated to analyze multilingual capabilities.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate stronger multilingual capabilities of models across the evaluated tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation involves performance comparison using different models across the included multilingual tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Informed consent was obtained from all individual participants included in the study.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent from participants involved in the studies.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: All procedures were in accordance with ethical standards of institutional and/or national research committees.
